description.value:
>@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.class-features.Item.G8R4eOCadeKA4lof]{Chaldiralist}

If you have the @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.Item.8rIj0ewW4bL8Uph5]{Confused}, @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.Item.7PPRS6krnvaTHbxh]{Fascinated}, @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.Item.JGFn4MrDZ6X5vrzU]{Fatigued}, @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.Item.nywSVEeDvp1bk7L3]{shaken}, @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.Item.ZacF0l6IwqBwToTJ]{Sickened}, or @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.conditions.Item.aAQ6SW6iK0EVq8Ce]{Staggered} condition caused by a foe at the beginning of your turn, you can spend 1 Resolve Point to attempt a Will save against the effect that gave you that condition, using that effect’s save DC. If you succeed, you don’t suffer the effects of that condition (though you continue experiencing anything else caused by the effect) for 1d4 rounds. The condition is merely suppressed, not removed, and its effects resume afterward. Against an effect that has no saving throw, the Will save DC equals 8 + the foe’s CR.
